intro: Gilia subacaulis, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Gilia subacaulis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
